episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features discussions on a Belgian man's surgery to look like Michael Jackson, the discovery of the largest Viking ship during museum renovations, the tobacco hornworm's defense mechanism of bad breath, and the phenomenon of micro-sleeps during sleep deprivation.

facts.fact: A number of years ago, some plastic surgeons in Belgium had a young Belgian man who came to them wanting to have surgery performed to make him look more like his idol, the singer Michael Jackson.
The largest Viking ship ever found was discovered when they renovated the Viking ship museum.
The tobacco hornworm uses extremely bad halitosis to prevent predators from eating it.
You could have fallen asleep up to five times during this podcast and not known about it.
